page.title: 06LANHYDROCK ESTATE
page.content: To contribute to its upkeep the estate and house now {trade}as a plant centre, gift shop selling worthwhile souvenirs of Cornwall and a restaurant created out of the housekeeper's and housemaids' rooms. The latter serves over three hundred visitors a day. Its menu consists of light snacks, such as savoury flans, jacket potatoes, shortbread, Cornish split, jam and cream, salads and Sunday lunches. They also produce some Victorian specialities, such as squat pie. The estate consists of 741 acres of park and woodland in the valley of the River Fowey. There is a wonderful avenue of beeches on the approach to the house. The formal gardens near the house laid out in 1857 still exist as does a magnificent shrubbery of azaleas and rhododendrons.
